thread.title: Two powerful IEDs recovered in Sukma
thread.title_full: Two powerful IEDs recovered in Sukma - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Two powerful IEDs recovered in Sukma
text:
RAIPUR: Security forces on Thursday recovered two powerful improvised explosive devices (IEDs) — suspected to have been planted by Maoists — from the roadside in Sukma district of Chhattisgarh.
The explosives packed in steel containers were seized from Injram-Bhejji road under Bhejji police station limits, a senior police official told PTI.
While one IED weighed 30 kgs, another was around 20 kgs, he added.
CRPF's 219 battalion was carrying out an anti-Maoist operation on Injram-Bhejji route, a Maoist hot bed, located around 500 kms away from the state capital. While cordoning off the road, they spotted the IEDs placed beneath the road near Gorkha camp averting a major mishap, the official said.
It was planted by rebels to target the security personnel during their operation in the area. The explosive was immediately defused by the bomb disposal squad, he added. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
